--- Derek James <blue5432@...> wrote:
<snip>
> Anyway, chime in if you like, and let us know what
> you're up to, or what you're thinking about.

I'm not currently working with NEAT, but I may in the
future.  The idea of adaptive topology is very
appealing to me, but the C++ implementation is not. 
The other features of NEAT are also of great interest,
including speciation and graphical display of
topology.   It would be a big hurdle for me to learn
enough C++ as well as understand the details of NEAT. 
I have always found it difficult to read other
people's code.

My own software in in C, and takes the approach of
very fast execution of simple topologies.  I will be
releasing the 4-card puzzle evolver within a week. 
This is well documented software that shows that a
recurrent network with fixed weights can remember past
inputs and make good use of them.


=====
Mitchell Timin
http://annevolve.sourceforge.net
